intro: Hieracium kaitumense, commonly known as the Kaitumense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium kaitumense is known for its ability to thrive in low-nutrient soils and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
